[00:00:23:02-00:01:49:22] A grown up Gordie says that he saw a dead body when he was 12. [00:01:49:23-00:04:58:22] Vern brags to Gordie, Chris, and Teddy that he knows the location of a dead body. [00:04:58:23-00:06:29:20] Vern overhears Billy and Charlie discussing their discovery of a dead body. [00:06:29:21-00:06:31:17] Teddy describes the area where the body lies. [00:06:31:18-00:08:12:19] Teddy, Chris, Vern, and Gordie decide to go look for the body of Ray Brower. [00:08:12:20-00:08:49:19] Gordie asks his mother where his canteen is. [00:08:49:19-00:10:32:08] Gordie fondly, yet sadly, remembers his brother, Denny. [00:10:32:09-00:14:10:14] Chris and Gordie play with a loaded gun. [00:14:10:15-00:15:15:10] Gordie, Chris, Vern, and Teddy set out to find the body of Ray Brower. [00:15:15:11-00:15:50:13] Gordie, Chris, Vern, and Teddy sing as they walk along the tracks. [00:15:50:14-00:18:00:01] Chris scolds Teddy for playing around on the tracks. [00:18:00:02-00:18:44:14] After Teddy tries to dodge the train, he makes peace with Chris. [00:18:44:15-00:19:47:15] Charlie tries to tell Ace about the body. [00:19:47:16-00:20:42:12] Gordie reminisces about the time that he and his friends broke into a legendary junk yard. [00:20:42:12-00:21:46:23] Chris and Gordie race. [00:21:47:00-00:22:45:12] Gordie, Chris, Vern, and Teddy talk about how much fun they are having. [00:22:45:13-00:24:08:10] The boys flip for who is going to get the food. [00:24:08:11-00:24:40:21] Teddy teases Gordie about having to get the food. [00:24:40:22-00:24:44:22] Gordie goes to the market to get food for the trip. [00:24:44:23-00:25:32:06] A shopkeeper recognizes that Gordie looks a lot like his brother. [00:25:32:07-00:26:47:05] Gordie remembers his older brother. [00:26:47:06-00:29:39:07] Gordie gets caught by the junk yard owner and must flee from the infamous dog. [00:29:39:08-00:31:52:21] Gordie, Chris, and Vern try to cheer Teddy up. [00:31:52:22-00:33:16:20] The news reports that the police have expanded their search for Ray Brower. [00:06:31:19-00:08:12:20] Sitting in their tree house, Vern Tessio tells his three friends, Gordie Lachance, Teddy Duchamp, and Chris Chambers, that he overheard his brother Billy talking about the dead body of the missing teenager Ray Brower. Chris, Teddy, and Gordie decide that if they found the body they'd get their picture in the paper and be heroes. The boys make a plan to tell their parents they are going to the races, when in fact they will be going to find the body of Ray Brower. [00:15:50:14-00:18:00:02] Gordie Lachance, Chris Chambers, Vern Tessio, and Teddy Duchamp are walking along the train tracks towards the location of the dead body of teenager Ray Brower. The boys realize they forgot to bring food and search their pockets for spare change. They agree to stop at the Qudiacioluo general store on the way. A train whistle blows in the distance and Chris, Vern, and Gordie move off the track. Teddy decides he's going to dodge the train. Chris screams at Teddy to get off the tracks, pulling him to the side. Chris and Teddy fight. [00:24:45:00-00:26:47:06] Gordie looks at food packages and Mr. Quidacioluo weighs the meat Gordie plans to buy for the rest of trip. Mr. Quidacioluo asks Gordie if he is Denny's younger brother and he remembers how great a football player Denny was; Denny died in a car accident. Gordie remembers feeling left out at family dinners where Denny was the main attraction. Denny was always kind and caring to his young brother Gordie, even when their parents ignored him. Mr. Quidacioluo snaps Gordie back into the present, asking Gordie what he does. Gordie, unsure, responds and pays for the food. [00:38:42:09-00:40:54:13] Gordie Lachance and Vern Tessio are falling behind Teddy Duchamp and Chris Chambers on the railroad tracks that span the bridge. Vern crawls slowly, afraid of heights. Gordie continues to turn around, checking to make sure there is no train. Suddenly, a whistle blows and boys all see the train. Running for their lives, the boys make their way across the tracks. Vern moves slowly and Gordie must literally push him along. Teddy and Chris scream from the end of the bridge. Gordie and Vern fall to the side of the bridge, barely escaping the train. [00:47:07:22-00:49:20:11] Lardass Hogan drinks a bottle of castor oil and swallows an egg whole before the pie eating contest. In the background, Mayor Grundy introduces the pie eating contestants. Gordie Lachance narrates this story as Lardass eats pie after pie, pretending it's really revolting animal innards instead of blueberry pie. Lardass wins the contest but at the last moment, gets his revenge on the people of the town who call him names by vomiting all over them. The members of the crowd become sick and everyone is covered in vomit. Lardass smiles and the story ends. [00:51:39:19-00:53:52:12] Vern Tessio, Teddy Duchamp, Chris Chambers, and Gordie Lachance are awakened by the sounds of wolves or coyotes howling in the woods. Teddy is convinced it is the ghost of the dead teenager. Chris has brought a gun for protection and the boys decide to take turns standing guard. Teddy takes first swatch, speaking to himself and pretending to be any army soldier. The boys yell at Teddy to be quiet so they can get some sleep. Vern takes the next watch and jumps at every sound. [00:57:21:17-00:59:22:02] Chris Chambers and Gordie Lachance are guarding the campfire as Teddy Duchamp and Vern Tessio sleep. Chris has a reputation amongst his friends as the cool guy because he stole milk money from someone at school. Chris explains that he tried to give the money back to the teacher and she spent it and used it on herself. Chris wanted to tell someone, but no one would believe him because his brother is a thug and they are lower class members of the town. Chris cries and get upset, while his friend Gordie comforts him. Chris did the right thing, even if the teacher took advantage of him. [01:03:13:12-01:05:04:08] Gordie Lachance, Chris Chambers, Vern Tessio, and Teddy Duchamp take a shortcut through the woods, but are stopped by a bog. Chris takes a stick and measures to see how deep the water is. The water appears to be shallow so the boys decide to walk across. As they take a few steps, all four sink down to their necks. Vern complains and Teddy makes fun of him. The boys splash and attack each other. [01:11:47:18-01:14:00:18] After finding the dead body of the teenager Ray Brower, Gordie Lachance becomes upset remembering the death of his brother Denny. Feeling like the unloved son, Gordie cries. Chris Chambers instructs his friends Vern Tessio and Teddy Duchamp to go get branches to carry the body while he comforts Gordie. Gordie tells Chris he wishes he had died instead of Denny. Chris comforts his friend, telling Gordie he will be a great writer someday and he could even write about the four of them. [01:15:39:05-01:17:49:10] Chris Chambers refuses to give the body of Ray Brower to Ace Merrill and his friends, who want it for reward money. Ace threatens Chris with a knife, while Teddy Duchamp tries to convince to let Ace have the body. Chris refuses to back down and Ace makes a move to cut him. Gordie Lachance comes to the rescue, shooting off the gun. Gordie threatens Ace, telling him to leave. Ace doesn't believe Gordie will shoot him, but Gordie does not back down. Ace and his gang leave but threaten Chris and Gordie that they will not forget what happened in the woods.
